meanings.definition: A solid figure with six faces, each of which is a parallelogram.
meanings.sent1: I saw a box made of parallelepipeds in the math class.
meanings.sent2: The building blocks were shaped like parallelepipeds.
meanings.sent3: The parallelepipeds on the shelf looked like a colorful puzzle.
meanings.sent4: Her room was filled with parallelepipeds, creating a geometric wonderland.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used parallelepipeds to explain 3D shapes to the students.

meanings.definition: A three-dimensional shape with six faces, each face being a parallelogram.
meanings.sent1: The toy set included various parallelepipeds for building structures.
meanings.sent2: The storage container was shaped like a series of parallelepipeds stacked together.
meanings.sent3: The parallelepipeds in the game resembled colorful blocks in a virtual world.
meanings.sent4: The city skyline was a collection of parallelepipeds reaching towards the sky.
meanings.sent5: The artist used parallelepipeds as the main theme in his sculpture exhibition.
